cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi SSW of Caibarién, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW tonight then NW, skirt the Lower Florida Keys Saturday, move north just offshore the west coast of Florida, and reach the Florida Panhandle late Sunday night–Monday morning.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southwest and west-central Gulf Coast of Florida, and the northeastern Gulf Coast toward the Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds up to 25–30 mph possible Sunday–Monday; tropical-storm conditions unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor Atlantic surge of 1–2 ft possible along the St. Johns River mouth; significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 2–4 inches with localized totals near 5 inches Sunday through Monday, causing brief ponding and minor flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low risk of isolated tornadoes in the surrounding inland areas Sunday afternoon and night.
